attributes.action: Ban plastic food containers at takeaways, food pots and trays
attributes.background: According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics. More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050,”
attributes.additional_details:
Many countries around the world have banned the use of plastics. The U.K. must take action now!

Time is up for plastic use! We must protect our ocean and the next generation!
#Banplasticuse4good #Banplasticfoodpots #Banplastictakeawayboxes

Plastic food pots and trays are often unrecyclable, say councils - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45058971

attributes.action: Make it a law that every work place need to supply air conditioning units.
attributes.background: Every work place now won’t supply air conditioning as it’s not Essential however if we made it a law many schools, nursurys and work places would Benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no law which says you have to go home just that your work place has to supply water. 
Let’s make a change!

attributes.action: Make more council houses available for part rent, part buy
attributes.background: I'm a working dad of 2 children under 2 year old. Me and my partner can't afford to live together as I don't earn enough to support us and pay private rent. The Government should introduce a scheme to make more council homes available for families to part rent part buy to get on the property ladder.
attributes.additional_details: More and more families are struggling to live together with young children. My children are 14 month old and a 2 week old. Like a lot of families me and my partner can’t afford to live together as I work full time and she doesn't as she raises the children. The systems we have in this country don't help people who work. Help to buy is only good if you can afford to save but with young children and paying rent that's more than a mortgage, it's hard to save.

attributes.action: Strip First Group and MTR of their South Western Railway Franchise.
attributes.background: Since taking over the Franchise from Stagecoach, the service that customers have had to put up with has been disgraceful. High prices, poor service, constant delays and without any punishment from the Government. Time it stops!

attributes.action: Scrap the MOT test.
attributes.background: The MOT test is outdated and does not save lives but only costs motorists money.

attributes.action: Make it legal in England to marry in a forest as it legal in Scotland
attributes.background: My son and his fiancee would like as would possibly many others to marry in a forest. Please help to try and make this happen

attributes.action: Ban Animal circuses in the UK. It is animal cruelty and completely barbaric.
attributes.background: I am tired of seeing endless videos and stories all over the internet and news of animals being killed or showing signs of such unnatural distress simply for our entertainment. As humans and as a community it is our duty to keep moving forward from senseless, unnecessary and straight up callous acts

attributes.action: Ban fake numbers being used for sales, marketing, PPI and personal injury calls.
attributes.background:
We frequently receive calls about that 'accident' we've had or about that PPI claim we could make.

Companies use a fake number, so that you have no way of tracing where the call from and so they are unaccountable.  

I propose that UK phone networks apply technology to block such calls.

attributes.action: provide free water for everyone on the street of UK in this extreme hot weather
attributes.background: I think water must be free in this hot weather for everyone specially homeless people living on the street. The government must provide funding to local councils to facilitate the supply of free water in the street on UK. The local government must help local shops to provide water to everyone.
attributes.additional_details: The condition is extremely hot and people can get dehydrated and homeless people are at higher risk. Water must be provided by the local government in form of a water fountain or local shops providing them by local council finding them. This is a government’s duty to keep their people safe.

attributes.action: It should be mandatory for schools to provide a summer uniform
attributes.background: Schools should have to provide a summer uniform for its students such as shorts, and a polo shirt or similar. This would help people concentrate in lessons because they wouldn’t be overly hot, like I was this summer.

attributes.action: Limit new drivers 1100cc- first 12 mths, 14000cc-12-24 mths, 1600cc-24-36 mths
attributes.background: The cost of insurance is too high and the volume of accidents involving young drivers is also too high, bringing this in would hopefully reduce both

attributes.action: Make causing a psychological injury (mental illness) a criminal offence.
attributes.background: We are calling on the Government to make it a crime to intentionally or recklessly cause unnecessary psychological injury to another; add mental illness to the list of reportable injuries in relation to work; and ensure that the cause of any illness that leads to a suicide is fully investigated.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 people suffers a mental illness during their lifetime.
Sometimes this is directly attributable to the behaviour of another or others.  In these cases the only legal remedy is a personal injury claim which lacks personal accountability and doesn't encourage improved behaviour.
In addition, psychological injuries don't currently have to be reported to the Health and Safety Executive so are not monitored.
Mental abuse is serious and should be given the same importance as physical abuse.

attributes.action: Require all buses to have seat belts
attributes.background: Buses have crashes and make sudden stops and people get injured all the time because they are not wearing seat belts.
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was involved in a bus accident (not the bus driver’s fault) where a taxi pulled out. This resulted in me being thrown from my chair and suffering bruised ribs and jarred my chest. This is why all buses should be required to have seat belts.

attributes.action: Require local councils to issue parking charges by recorded delivery
attributes.background: Sending PCNs by 2nd class postage does not guarantee delivery to home addresses and as a result quite often representation or appeal of the contravention is missed. Recorded delivery would eliminate this issue and the cost should be added to the original PCN meaning no cost to the council.
attributes.additional_details: There are many instances on multiple forums of people experiencing this exact issue. It’s unfair to not have received the original letter on time and as a result the fine being multiplied and even in some cases warrants issued to bailiffs. I personally didn't receive the first PCN letter and the fine was £65, now the fine is £195 as a result of not receiving the 2nd class letter sent out by the local council. Is this fair or just a money making loop hole by the councils.

attributes.action: Give free sanitary products for girls in primary and secondary schools.
attributes.background: As the fifth largest economy no girls should be in a place where sanitary products are not available in school. As of next year Wales will give out free sanitary products to all girls in primary and secondary schools. It now time to follow in Wales footstep.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/free-sanitary-products-given-schoolgirls-14805724

attributes.action: Increase funding for local councils to tackle homelessness.
attributes.background: Poverty in general is a prevalent issue in the UK; homelessness rates have been significantly increasing; why is the government's form of action evidently not working, if there is any?

attributes.action: Full Public Investigation into all Unresolved Complaints of NHS Medical Errors
attributes.background: For over 40 yrs, the system has failed to protect patients who have suffered medical accidents/errors under the NHS. A toxic culture has prevailed within the NHS of closing ranks to cover up complaints. We need a new body to investigate all unresolved complaints and the misuse of powers/public money
attributes.additional_details: Given the gravity of scale of covering up by the NHS & lack of action taken by complaint bodies & those in Government, this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate all complaints. In order to avoid harm to patients the government need to carry out an investigation across the UK to identify the systemic failure across the NHS & avoid future harm to patients. It must include victims left with ongoing health problems/disabilities & families who have lost a loved one since 1980

attributes.action: Lower the age of consent to 14 or 15
attributes.background: I believe that people hit puberty at about 12. At 14-15, people are still going through puberty but I believe that they are also mature enough to give consent.
attributes.additional_details: Underage sex/pregnancy is a big issue. Moving the age of consent down, while still keeping it at an age where people are old enough to give consent, would reduce underage sex.

attributes.action: Remove the VAT on purchase of defibrillators
attributes.background: Encourage the purchase of these life saving devices. Small communities are raising funds to buy these defibrillators for no reason other than to save life. Maybe yours, maybe mine, or maybe a loved one. Remove the tax and encourage the acquisition of this life saving and life changing technology

attributes.action: Tax breaks for public houses that ONLY serve beverages manufactured in the UK.
attributes.background: To aid against the loss of public houses across the UK, many of which are central to a community. Also providing a boost to UK brewers/manufacturing. And creating more jobs in this sector.

attributes.action: Immediate cap on fees charged by letting agents
attributes.background: The rental market is open to abuse by letting agents who can name their price; there is no correlation between the costs they incur and the fees charged. It's a free for all, with fees for the same processes widely differing for no apparent reason but to put more money in the pocket of the agent.
attributes.additional_details:
Do these examples seem fair?

Print & sign tenancy contract: £120
What does it really cost to print a document?

Credit check: £100
Credit checks typically cost less than £30

Moving in fee covering background & credit check: £395
That's £395 BEFORE you've even paid your rent & deposit. And if you 'fail' you lose your money.

We're not proposing scrapping the fees, after all the agents do incur costs. But a cap would give clarity for all, and prevent profiteering hitting renters in the pocket.

attributes.action: Stop private parking companies from imposing fines after you leave the premises.
attributes.background: Parliament should legislate to stop Private Parking Companies from imposing penalty charges after a vehicle has left the location where enforcement is in place.
attributes.additional_details:
Private parking companies should only be able to impose a charge on the spot or must install barriers at entry and exit points to accept payment.
 
Issuing notices by post should be prohibited. 
 
It is a simple solution to a very controversial industry.

attributes.action: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour
attributes.background: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour.  When you attend a hospital for treatment or to visit someone then you are probably under stress, so finding extra money to pay for car parking (especially the high charges some hospitals charge) is just adding to the stress your under.
attributes.additional_details: I suspect that some people are choosing to go without food etc just to pay for car parking charges which can mount up if  you are there for some hours and have to visit on several occassions.  The government intervened in the gambling laws they could intervene in this. These charges effect the most vunerable in our society, the sick, low paid, the ones that can't afford to go private.

attributes.action: Lower the university fee for all students! By atleast £1000
attributes.background: Students are thinking about university as summer starts however most are drawn back due to the large amount of cash they have to pay per year! The goverment need to start deciding what to put their money on wisely if they want a bright future for the UK.

attributes.action: Replace the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation
attributes.background: I believe that the ombudsman service just has not got the ability to handle complaints about financial services. There is evidence in the media and on online review services like trustpilot.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to consider replacing the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation that is not funded by, or affiliated with, the banks and other financial services.

attributes.action: Condemn killings by the Indian government
attributes.background: On 23rd May 2018, Indian and local Tamil Nadu government forces killed 13 unarmed civilians protesting against environmental disaster created by Sterlite copper in Tuticorin, TN owned by Vedanta resources plc.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must condemn this human rights violation and urge the India Government to protect human rights, including people’s right to protest.

attributes.action: To implement a notice period before stopping disability benefits after reviewing
attributes.background: At present many genuine disability claimants are losing benefits without any prior warning after going through a biased assessment process. Thus placing them instantly into financial difficulties and a world of uncertainty & worry even rendering many unable to actually pay the bills etc.
attributes.additional_details: Being thrust into a world of woe. Going through the stresses of being suddenly financially restricted then chasing the gov for reconsideration and then forcing an appeal process which many win this process surely costs the gov even more going through the whole tribunal process takes months to  year. Yes the money gets backdated. But all that addition stress and worry is totally Unnecessary. In human rights terms it's totally disgusting that our DWP treats the disabled this way.

attributes.action: Allow Left turns on red like in the USA
attributes.background: So in the USA you can legally turn Right on a red light which helps with easing traffic and lowering co2 emmisons So I think that when applicable We should be allowed to turn left on red due to us driving on the left side of the road. This would greatly decrease co2 emmisons and traffic in cities.

attributes.action: Establish an Atrocities Prevention Board.
attributes.background: Human rights and the prevention of mass atrocities should be at the centre of our foreign policy thinking. An Atrocities Prevention Board, made up of representatives from across government, would ensure a comprehensive approach to identify and address threats to vulnerable groups of people.
attributes.additional_details:
Barack Obama established an Atrocities Prevention Board (ABP) in 2012. It has improved the US government's ability to identify early threats and widened the tools with which those threats can be dealt with. It has also provided the impetus to take early action in a number of countries that might otherwise not have received such attention.

A UK equivalent could spur on a similar change and ensure that genocide and mass atrocity prevention are a priority at the highest levels of government.

attributes.action: Launch an awareness campaign for the causes and symptoms of skin cancer
attributes.background: Last year I had Melanoma and there was little awareness out there, there is more than 1 type of skin cancer. I feel that there is little awareness out there about them and about damage the sun/sun beds can do. There needs to be more campaigns to help prevent it.

attributes.action: Introduce Stronger Legislation Governing The Sale of Animal Grooming Products.
attributes.background: At present, companies that produce cosmetic products for animals are under no legal compulsion to label their products appropriately or adhere to the safety standards that regulate the sale of human cosmetics. We want the UK Government to address this with the introduction of stronger legislation.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation affecting the sale of pet products is currently encompassed by EU Cosmetic Regulation 1223/2009 and Section 7.7 (a) of Regulation (EC) No 648/2004 on detergents (European Union, 2009) which states there is no 'sector specific' legislation governing the sale of pet grooming products. We believe the UK can lead the world in introducing stronger legislation forcing a reappraisal in the way in which these products are regulated and labelled.

attributes.action: At 17 you should be able to ride atleast a 250Cc superbike / Pitbike ( Crosser )
attributes.background:
At 17 you're legally allowed to ride a 125Cc. (75 MPH max ).        
So instead make it so you can ride a 250 Cc.

attributes.action: To make it illegal to walk any Dog in temperatures above 70 degrees Fahrenheit
attributes.background: Just being left outside without shade or exercise on a hot day can kill your dog! Avoid High Temperatures & Direct Sunlight anything over 70 degrees your dog is at risk from heat exhaustion. Dogs have fur and can’t sweat.  Dogs can only expel heat through their feet and by panting.

attributes.action: Lower the cost of taking the Practical driving test.
attributes.background: Every year roughly 850,000 driving tests are conducted but only 47-50% pass. That means one in two tests taken leads to a fail. Although the tests are getting harder, the price of it still remains incredibly high at £62.00. Driving should be a fun and educational life skill not a burden.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Roughly 850,000 driving tests are taken every year in the UK.
2. Only 47-50% pass the test.
3. Tests are getting harder but price is still sky high at £62.00.
4. If you are using your instructors vehicle the cost may increase even more.

attributes.action: Institute a Personage & Citizenry Act
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call on parliament to institute a new act that grants automatic citizenship to any persons that can demonstrate that they have lived continuously in this country for 15 or more years. Subject to having not committed a serious criminal offence
attributes.additional_details:
This act would help secure the rights of people affected by the windrush scandal as well as those people who have migrated here that may be subject to the same treatment in the future.

Personage should be granted to those who are working here to act as a temporary status of citizenry for 5 years. If they continue to hold employment for that time then at the end of the 5 years they are granted full citizenry.

attributes.action: Investigate the role of the Information Commission due to its ineffectiveness
attributes.background: Call for an investigation into the role of the ICO and why they refer the public back to, and do not act against, the public bodies/organisations who do not reply to data requests and maintain their silence in order to block/obstruct complaints. Urgent changes/reforms to the law need to be made
attributes.additional_details: Due to the advice by the petitions committee when rejecting 3 petitions - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/206379 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/205268 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/213769 we call on the government/Secretary of State to make appropriate provision to ensure that the Information Commission act to assist members of the public to obtain full disclosure of their records in order to pursue complaints further & ban public bodies from withholding records

attributes.action: Vehicle tax to include levy for repair of roads maintained by local authorities
attributes.background: The condition of local roads is poor.  Pot holes and bad repairs are a mounting problem that impact all road users.  The situation in places can be dangerous and cause significant costs.  A link to vehicle tax would be a link to the number of vehicles and thus provide proportionate funds.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence can be found in the budget of local authorities.  Requirements exceed funding, over many years, by large amounts.

attributes.action: Fund “Off The Street, Less Heat” youth project and similar projects
attributes.background: Off the Street, Less Heat is a youth diversion project which provides sports and other workshops to distract young people from anti-social behaviour, gang-related violence and street crime. Due to Government cuts, it and projects like it have lost funding.
attributes.additional_details: Off the Street, Less Heat was started in 2006/07 by Elaine Roberts, who came up with the name and idea, to help get young people off the streets and welcome people from all different communities. The project also aims to improve the relations between the police and the local community. Off the Street, Less Heat and similar projects all over the country need direct funding from the Government to ensure that they can continue.

attributes.action: Stop Public Health England's recent 'Healthy Eating' initiatives.
attributes.background: PHE have launched several initiatives to make people more 'calorie-aware'. This includes Change4Life's 'look for 100-calorie snacks, two a day max' and the One You Campaign, which advises adults to follow a 400-600-600 diet. Calorie Counting leads to a fixation on numbers and disordered eating.
attributes.additional_details: Anorexia has the highest mortality rate of any psychiatric disorder, with at least 20% of Anorexia sufferers dying prematurely. (Source: BEAT Eating Disorders). Full recovery from this illness involves moving away from all preoccupation with food. Therefore, calorie counting is incompatible with recovery and may lead to a rise in eating disorders. Please support me to ensure more people are protected from this life-ruining condition.

attributes.action: Teach about Babylonian history in schools!
attributes.background: The babylionan civilasation contributed immensly in shaping the worlds history. They contributed to one of the earliest forms of writting, the first ever laws through the code of Hammurabi, science and astrology and maths. This should be taught in schools.

attributes.action: Cap the price of private and university owned student accommodation
attributes.background: Students are becoming more ripped off by the price of student accommodation each year thus becoming harder to live. It is already unfair that Student Finance dictate our maintenance loan based on our household income and the majority have to live in a student overdraft. We want fair reduced prices.

attributes.action: The abolition of Audit total exemption for small private limited companies.
attributes.background: This provision is being severely abused by many claiming that their retained annual profit is around £200 - £2,000, totally unrealistic, and is costing the Treasury and the NHS billions of pounds in loss revenue and, above all, nothing is done about it.

attributes.action: Make it an offense for essay writing services to advertise to under 16's
attributes.background: In the same way that gambling, alcohol and cigarettes are prohibited from advertising to minors, I suggest similar measures be applied to companies like UK Essays and other Essay Mills in order to protect minors from being unduly influenced by manipulative marketing practices.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Essays Website:
https://www.ukessays.com/services/essay-writing-service.php
Facebook Ad:
https://www.facebook.com/UKEssays/posts/10159836527715151
Twitter Ad:
https://twitter.com/UKEssays/status/970984231051636736

attributes.action: Increase the expenditure of money on prisons.
attributes.background: The prison system hasn't been correctly funded or managed for years. We propose that the government spends more of its expenditure on the prison system to increase capacity and pursue its purpose.

attributes.action: Urge the international community to bring Bashar al Assad to justice.
attributes.background:
Since the start of the Syrian Civil War in 2011, hundreds of thousands of civilians have been murdered in Syria, with the vast majority of deaths being attributed to Assad and his forces.

The international community must do more to bring Assad to justice.
attributes.additional_details:
Assad has invalidated his sovereignty over Syria. Hundreds of thousands of his own people have been murdered and tortured. Intervention is justified and necessary both morally and politically on the basis of these grave human rights violations. 

http://sn4hr.org

http://www.syriahr.com/en/

attributes.action: Introduce a separate, higher minimum wage for temporary workers and agency staff
attributes.background:
This petition is to help address the issue of unstable employment in our economy and to help promote the concerns about zero hour and temporary contracts. 
If temporary workers were given a higher minimum wage then this could encourage employers to offer permanent contracts and reduce exploitation.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to ride motorcycles with a higher engine size than 50cc.
attributes.background: 16 years old are in danger of being taken off their bikes due to them being restricted and other volumes of traffic going at a much higher rate of speed past them, therefore increasing the accidents including young riders. 125cc would possibly be a better replacement as safer in the long term.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment the law states that 16 year olds cannot ride any motorcycle with an engine size higher than 50cc, this can be very dangerous as many roads now have speed limits way higher than this not allowing you to keep up with traffic or get out of a situation very quickly, therefore increasing the accidents including motorcycles and young riders. 125cc is a more sensible speed which is more reliable for young riders out on the roads at 16. To make sure it is safe for a young driver an additional test could be added allowing you to progress up rather than just a CBT, this time including a small theory

attributes.action: Ratify Kampala amendments, give ICC jurisdiction over UK for crime of aggression
attributes.background:
The International Criminal Court, through the Kampala amendments (2010), is gaining jurisdiction over the crime of aggression on 17 July 2018, for those states that have ratified the amendments.

The UK, having pushed for this for decades, must ratify.

attributes.action: Inquiry on collapse of Monarch & the safeguarding of pensions
attributes.background: There have been calls for a public inquiry to the collapse of Monarch airlines and maybe look into changing the law on pensions so when a company goes into administration money can be put aside for the pension fund.
attributes.additional_details: The Chair of Parliament’s Work and Pensions Committee expressed concern over claims that private equity group Greybull Capital could avoid losing money while the carrier’s pension fund – which is owed £7.5m – could be among creditors left with nothing.

attributes.action: Make black plastic illegal
attributes.background: Currently in the UK only a third of plastic can be recycled. The public have been placing their plastic in the green bins completely unawares that most will end in landfill or incinerated. One of the quickest ways the Government can reduce this is to ban black plastic packaging.
attributes.additional_details: This featured as a main story on the BBC news on the 4th of August 2018.
